Just a heads-up - you will need to include the intl-proxy package for this feature as well.
Look at the NumberFormat/DateFormat page for reasoning and instructions.

Some languages differ in their grammatic or wording based on
the amount of something. English also has this phenomenon in a very basic form: 
One {H0b|page|}, Two {H0b|pages|}. What if you could match on these plural forms?

Well it turns out you can! Simply wrap a {H1code|NUMBER|}
function call around your variable in a case interpolation. Now you won't be matching on specific
numbers but on {H0a|categories|href|https://www.unicode.org/cldr/cldr-aux/charts/30/supplemental/language_plural_rules.html}. The valid categories are 
'zero', 'one', 'two', 'few', 'many' and 'other'.
